summary: This document is an email chain from 2016-2017 between Steve Smith, a sales representative for SigNet Technologies, and an unidentified recipient regarding a quote and proposal for upgrading a DVR security camera system, with the recipient's name redacted. The discussion involves increasing the camera count to 350 and providing proposals for both an upgrade and a complete new system.

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.context: Steve Smith is the Federal Sales Representative for SigNet Technologies, corresponding via email to provide quotes and proposals for a DVR security system upgrade, discussing camera counts and system options.

events.title: Initial DVR Upgrade Inquiry
events.description: Steve Smith emails an unidentified recipient to discuss working on a quote for a DVR upgrade.

events.title: Discussion on System Re-use
events.description: Steve Smith asks the recipient if they want a complete swap out or to re-use some existing components like the AMS and decoder.

events.title: Request for Quotes
events.description: The unidentified recipient requests quotes for both a new complete system and an upgrade of the current system.

events.title: Proposal Submission
events.description: Steve Smith sends the first of two proposals for the DVR upgrade, with one using existing equipment and another being a complete turnkey system.

events.title: Camera Count Increase
events.description: Steve Smith confirms he will increase the camera count to 350 as per a phone call with the recipient.

locations: 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E B I vill MD 2 7
keyFacts: The email chain involves a discussion about upgrading a DVR security camera system, with the camera count being increased to 350.
The recipient's name is redacted in the document, indicated by blanks or placeholders like 'Mr. [redacted]'.
SigNet Technologies, represented by Steve Smith, is providing proposals for both upgrading the existing system and installing a complete new turnkey system.
The correspondence spans from November 2016 to January 2017, showing an ongoing business discussion about security system specifications.
The document includes references to existing equipment like an AMS and decoder that could potentially be re-used in the upgrade.
